pr_title: [PPL] Added integration tests for query analysis and search, where, fields commands

timeline.message: Redefined null lists to empty lists
Added PPL query analysis integration test
Added PPL where command integration test
Added PPL fields command integration test
Added PPL search command integration test

timeline.author: dai-chen
dai-chen

replies.bodyText: Thanks for the reminder. Changed the case to range, is that making sense?
replies.author: chloe-zh

timeline.bodyText: The test method name should be nonexistent field? But I think we do need another one for index.
timeline.author: dai-chen

replies.bodyText: It should be nonexistent field, corrected it now. It seems we have not set semantic check for index, let's add the index check when the index check is enabled.
replies.author: chloe-zh

replies.bodyText: The ElasticsearchIndex.getFieldTypes() should throw Elasticsearch IndexNotFoundException. Not sure if the exception is caught without re-throw or for other reason.
replies.author: dai-chen

replies.bodyText: Yes Elasticsearch throws this exception. I didn't add it here because it's not handled by the semantic check. Maybe we can add this to other test
replies.author: chloe-zh

timeline.bodyText:
Is it possible to assert all the response instead of just one field. e.g.
schema(contains("name", "string")))
or we can assert the full string match.
Actually, we don't need much data for integration test purpose, IMO, the sample data include all the types, null, missing should be enough for IT purpose.
timeline.author: penghuo

replies.bodyText:
I'm considering to add a utils to build result set and schema from the result, so that we can test the behavior by asserting the expected and actual result set rather comparing result strings.
For the sample data, what about applying bank_with_null_values (already in our resources) to all tests?
replies.author: chloe-zh
